description: Ex-Arsenal defender Carl Jenkinson signs a new contract with Bromley.
title: Carl Jenkinson: Ex-Arsenal defender signs new Bromley contract
title_page: Carl Jenkinson: Ex-Arsenal defender signs new Bromley contract - BBC Sport
maintext:
Ex-Arsenal defender Carl Jenkinson has signed a new contract with Bromley.
The 33-year-old has made 13 appearances since joining the Ravens in September.
Right-back Jenkinson has helped Bromley to 13th in League Two in their first ever season in the English Football League.
The south-east London club did not state the length of the new contract.
Jenkinson began his career at Charlton Athletic before moving to Arsenal in 2011, where he made 70 appearances and won the FA Cup in 2013-14.
He joined Nottingham Forest in 2019 before spending time in Australia, playing for Melbourne City on loan and moving to the Newcastle Jets in 2022.
Jenkinson has one England cap, earned against Sweden in 2012.
